channel.title: CyberNetSec - Patch Management
channel.description: Latest patch management threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Noction IRP v4.3 Launches with Automated DDoS Detection and Routing-Native Mitigation
item.description:
Noction has released version 4.3 of its Intelligent Routing Platform (IRP), introducing a major new feature called Automatic Anomaly Detection (AAD). This capability uses behavior-based traffic analysis to rapidly identify DDoS attacks and other network anomalies. Once an attack is detected, the pla...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Cyberattack, Security Operations, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Critical Flaw in WordPress Plugin 'Modular DS' Actively Exploited for Admin Takeover
item.description:
A critical, unauthenticated privilege escalation vulnerability in the 'Modular DS' WordPress plugin is being actively exploited in the wild. The flaw, tracked as CVE-2026-23550 with a CVSS score of 10.0, affects over 40,000 websites. It allows attackers to bypass authentication and gain full adminis...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Palo Alto Networks Patches High-Severity DoS Flaw in PAN-OS Firewalls
item.description:
Palo Alto Networks has issued security updates to address a high-severity denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability, CVE-2026-0227, in its PAN-OS software. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 7.7, allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to crash firewalls that have a GlobalProtect gateway or portal e...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Mandates Patch for Exploited Windows Zero-Day Used in Attack Chains
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has ordered federal agencies to patch a zero-day vulnerability in the Windows Desktop Window Manager (CVE-2026-20805) by February 3, 2026. The medium-severity information disclosure flaw is being actively exploited in the wild as a cru...

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Rockwell & YoSmart ICS Equipment
item.description:
CISA has released several Industrial Control Systems (ICS) advisories, warning of significant vulnerabilities in widely deployed equipment from Rockwell Automation and YoSmart. A high-severity SQL injection flaw (CVE-2025-12807) in Rockwell's FactoryTalk platform could allow for database takeover, w...

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: Microsoft's January 2026 Patch Tuesday Fixes 114 Flaws, Including One Exploited Zero-Day
item.description:
Microsoft has released its first Patch Tuesday of 2026, a substantial update that addresses 114 security vulnerabilities across a wide range of its products, including Windows, Office, Azure, and SharePoint. The release includes fixes for eight critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities an...

Severity: High

Categories: Patch Management, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: Urgent Patch: CISA Adds Actively Exploited Gogs RCE Flaw to KEV Catalog
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical path traversal vulnerability, CVE-2025-8110, in the Gogs self-hosted Git service to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. This flaw, which allows for remote code execution (RCE) via symlink manipulatio...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Read Full Article →

item.title: High-Severity Flaw in Mailpit Dev Tool Allows Email Interception
item.description:
A high-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2026-22689, has been discovered in Mailpit, a popular email testing tool for developers. The flaw is a Cross-Site WebSocket Hijacking (CSWSH) issue affecting all versions prior to 1.28.2. It allows a remote attacker to intercept sensitive data, including...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: YARA-X Update Helps Analysts Avoid Flawed Detection Rules
item.description:
Version 1.11.0 of YARA-X, a popular tool for malware analysis, has been released with a key enhancement aimed at improving the accuracy of detection rules. The update introduces 'hash function warnings,' a feature that alerts security analysts when they make common errors in hash string comparisons,...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Security Operations, Patch Management, Threat Intelligence

Read Full Article →

item.title: Cisco Patches Medium-Severity Flaws in Snort 3 Engine That Could Lead to DoS and Data Leaks
item.description:
Cisco has disclosed two medium-severity vulnerabilities, CVE-2026-20026 and CVE-2026-20027, in its widely used Snort 3 detection engine. The flaws exist in the processing of DCE/RPC traffic and can be triggered by a remote, unauthenticated attacker. CVE-2026-20026 (CVSS 5.8) is a use-after-free issu...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Read Full Article →
